abstract: British seismologist Bria Baptie says that two minor earthquakes in northwestern England appear to be caused by use of hydraulic fracturing by energy company Cuadrilla Resources; procedure, also known as 'fracking,' has raised concerns about environmental and seismological risks in the United States.
snippet: The high-pressure injection of materials called fracking could cause small temblors, the seismologist said, but not larger ones.
lead_paragraph: The high-pressure injection of materials called fracking could cause small temblors, the seismologist said, but not larger ones.

headline.main: Expert Says Quakes in England May Be Tied to Gas Extraction
headline.print_headline: Expert Says Quakes in England May Be Tied to Gas Extraction
